trial_identification.studytitle: Propofol induction in cannabis using patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Dose of Propofol for induction of general anaesthesia in cannabis using patients

interventions.interventions: The dose of propofol required to induce general anaesthesia will be compared in cohorts of patients who use cannabis regularly and those who do not use it at all. The duration of the intervention is 90 seconds, the time required to reach or not reach primary endpoint of unconsciousness.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The successful insertion of a laryngeal mask after induction of anaesthesia

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The dose of intravenous propofol required to achieve a bispectral index value of less than 60.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Weight >100kgs, cardiovascular disease, use of opiod,cocaine or amphetamines,benzodiazepine & SSRI use, allergy to propofol,alcohol abuse, anti retro-viral therapy, unstable pre-induction BIS value.

trial_design.sequence: Allocation to one of 5 groups, in blocks within each of the two cohorts of 30. This was achieved by using a computer software randomisation sequence.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Department of Anaesthesia and Pain Medicine, Royal Perth Hospital, Wellington St Perth WA 6000

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Trial completed and published 2009 Flisberg P, Paech MJ, Shah T, Ledowski T, Kurowski I, Parsons R. Induction dose of propofgol in patients using cannabis. Euro J Anaesthesiol 2009;26:192-5

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Royal Perth Hospital Wellington St Perth WA 6000
